storyInfo: Manfred's troops approach Lifebone with Ulšulah's help. W engages Qalid'čoa and unexpectedly learns the truth of Theresa's rebirth.

attributes.content: Paprika, Paprika!
attributes.name: Timid Mercenary

attributes.content: Hey, stay still!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Let's run for it!
attributes.name: Timid Mercenary

attributes.content: What are you talking about?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Haven't you noticed? The mercenaries under that W are all gone. The Military Commission's troops must have arrived.
attributes.name: Timid Mercenary

attributes.content: All the more reason to not run around and get caught in the crossfire.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Don't forget it was the Military Commission that hired us!
attributes.name: Timid Mercenary

attributes.content: If they've come, it's curtains for the guys here!
attributes.name: Timid Mercenary

attributes.content: If we make a run for it now, we could still explain things to General Manfred!
attributes.name: Timid Mercenary

attributes.content: You want to go back to him?! He'll just send you back to Victoria to kill more people. Is that what you want?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: You think we have a choice? What do you think the General will do to us when he finds out that we surrendered?
attributes.name: Timid Mercenary

attributes.content: I'll run errands if they tell me to run errands, and I'll kill if they tell me to kill. Whatever it takes to survive.
attributes.name: Timid Mercenary

attributes.content: You want to stay, that's your choice. I'm going. Goodbye.
attributes.name: Timid Mercenary

attributes.content: Fifty hours into the operation...
Aren't you the lucky one, Major Ulšulah.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: It's not every day that you get to lose a critical objective, be captured by the enemy, and still make it back in one piece.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Looks like you got along well with your old Scar Market buddies.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Watch your tone, Nachzehrer. It's not your place to judge my failure.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Regardless of the circumstances, Major Ulšulah's survival is good news for the Military Commission.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: General Manfred, I—
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: I know about the Sanguinarch's death. You can explain later.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: As for now, I hope you've returned with something of value.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I have the skeleton's location... and details about the mercenaries guarding it.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: That's all? Sounds like it would've been more worth it if you had stayed in the hands of those mercenaries.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: I want to hear what you think.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: The mercenaries are trying to reawaken the Feranmut skeleton. Whatever their plans are, it has something to do with them.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: I don't know what they're plotting, but they don't have a lot of people guarding the skeleton, for some reason.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Is Hoederer among them?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: Surround the canyon.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Take back the spine, no matter the cost.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Yes, sir!
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: General Manfred, for the upcoming battle—
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: You won't be needed. Stay in the rear.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: As a precaution, may I ask...
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: What are your plans if we're unable to take back the skeleton quickly?
attributes.name: Ulšulah

attributes.content: I don't enjoy such hypotheticals, Ulšulah.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Manfred's troops are here. They're a little earlier than expected.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What about the Royal Court's men? Nothing from Ulšulah?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: She got away.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It's my fault...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We'll talk about this later.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Where's W?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: She went out to scout the battlefield. Worst case scenario, she'll run into the enemy before we do.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: If Ulšulah got back to Manfred, they may have information on our current location and defenses.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: We're significantly outnumbered. A prolonged fight doesn't favor us.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: It's been fifty hours since the Doctor's team set out. Any news?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Nothing.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We have to hold out until the agreed time.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Given our odds, the only way to hold off the Military Commission for a day is if they were struck by a Catastrophe. But as things stand, even Catastrophes are at their command.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The Military Commission won't let this weapon fall into our hands and threaten their aerial supremacy. They'll come at us with everything they have.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: We'll have to take the chance.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The chance that Manfred doesn't want to destroy the skeleton either.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I hope you really know Manfred as well as you think you do.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: One last question. What happens if we don't get word from the Doctor when the agreed time has passed?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Then we abandon the skeleton.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: There's no point fighting to the death. Evacuation comes first. Our main priority is always to keep as many people alive as we can.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Reasonable. No objections.
attributes.name: Ascalon
Hoederer
attributes.content: There's another way that might delay the Royal Court's attack...

attributes.name: Hoederer
attributes.content: Killing their commander.
Ascalon.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Agreed.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: I'll kill him.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.text: It's freezing.
I don't want to admit it, but I can feel my heart race. Damn, stop trembling!
It's just like that time when I had to face Talulah alone—no, even worse.
This strange figure must be the master of those monsters and this realm. Yet, I sense no hostility from him—it's as if my presence is not worth his attention.
He just keeps hacking at the crystallized bones with his axe without even looking my way. Did he kill all these people?
I have my finger on my trigger, but I can't move an inch.
Pull yourself together, W! Haven't you seen your fair share of monsters by now?
Find out who he is, and what this cavern has to do with Theresa. Pry it out of his mouth, if that's what it takes.

attributes.content: Alright, I don't have time to waste on you, you sorry piece of wood. I have a few questions, and your answers will decide whether my next move is to throw bombs at your face or not.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: This is a Confessarius altar. Are you a Confessarius?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Clank. Clank.
The relentless and haunting sound of axe striking bone echoes through the cavern, as if carrying the weight of eras forgotten.
He slowly opens his mouth to speak.
I am a servant of Qui'sartuštaj, the King of Sarkaz.
The bloodline of the King perseveres through life and death.
If he who serves the King of Sarkaz is a Confessarius, then a Confessarius, I am.
So you can talk.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I'll give you a chance to introduce yourself before I shoot. What is this place? What does it have to do with the Confessarii?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Qa... lid'čoa... 'The Key'.
But this key opens no door, not anymore. Now, I am merely the warden of this deep, dark tomb.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: What are you talking about? A tomb? For who?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The countless heroes of Kazdel, and the foes who died at their hands.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: The Gravebearer, the Magnificent Eight, the Brave Eleven... all have fallen in the course of history, and I have buried many of them.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: Here lies their weapons and armor, remnants of the past.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: You must be joking. You knew all those people? Don't tell me, you're as ancient as that old hag?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I don't know why you old freaks keep clinging to the past. Are you going to let yesterday's bad jam stop you from eating today? Okay... I need to workshop that.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Many emerged from that epoch of heroes, becoming the new hope of the Sarkaz, time and again...
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: But all of them failed, joining the ashes and dust in this tomb.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: You stand upon the sword of Qui'lon, the Wrathful Cerulean Flame.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: Theresis left it here, because he refused to use it. Still, it is not proper to step upon it.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa
W
attributes.content: Qui'lon? Isn't he a character in myths and legends—

attributes.name: W
attributes.content: You're not playing me for a fool, are you?

attributes.text: Damn, I took a step back without even realizing it.
Why should I believe him? And why shouldn't I step on Qui'lon's sword, even if it was real?

attributes.content: I have answered your questions. Now you shall answer, mine.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: Why do you trespass upon this place?
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: Clank.
The axe swings again. The shockwave almost makes W take another step back.
I'm here to pick a fight with the Confessarii. What's that altar used for? Tell me, or else!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The mission of this altar has ended. No one visits this place anymore, except fools who stumble upon it.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.text: That strange fellow answered all my questions with flat interest. Clearly, he'd rather return to this work with the axe than engage with me.
I've lashed out at him, but my anger was met with no response. It's like throwing stones into a bottomless pit.
What did he mean? He's not with the Confessarii? Shouldn't he have come after me with his axe the moment the words left my mouth?

attributes.content: Hey, I'm talking to you—
attributes.name: W

attributes.text: The smoke clears, but the gaunt figure remains upright.
I didn't think I could take him out with a single bomb, but seriously, not even a scratch?

attributes.content: Futile. This vessel will never change again.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: A failed vessel that has been denied both eternal life as the instrument of the Crown's coming, and the sweet release of death.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: So you're one of the Confessarii's failed experiments too?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You feel bad for yourself? I could free you from your suffering.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: It is but futile.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: The man swings his stone axe and bats away W's bomb, as though swatting away a fly.

attributes.text: Good, I got a response from him.
That means there's a chance!
Three, two—
The bomb falls exactly where I expected it to. A section of the cavern collapses, trapping him beneath, but not enough to kill him.
I point my gun at his head.

attributes.content: You said the Confessarii made you indestructible? Let's see if I can't blow a hole in your brain at this range.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The Confessarii like their experiments, don't they? Did you guys make those bighead moths? Disgusting den of monsters.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Cut the poetry and answer my questions. Did you know Theresa?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The exiled one has had the honor of seeing that King of Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: This, is where the tragic King was reborn.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: This is the place... they... how did they do it?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The Confessarii brought the King's bloodied body back, and cut her soul from the myriad. But she was already entwined within the myriad, and could no longer exist as herself.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: W turns around, toward the altar in the center of the cavern.
The menacing building looks unnerving and smells faintly of blood.

attributes.text: What had happened here?
I dare not think about it, but I can't stop myself.

attributes.content: Why...?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The present of Sarkaz needed her to die. The future of Sarkaz needed her to live.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: As the King of Sarkaz, she gave her all, her spirit and her wisdom, her blood and her bone.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: You followed the King's path as her former subject, but she is no longer the one you knew.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: I saw her awakening, the sorrow on her face. I saw the weight on her soul, her eternal torment.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: Enough... shut up.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: She was a sacrifice to the myriad souls, to Kazdel, to all the past and future Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: I said SHUT UP!
attributes.name: W

attributes.text: I've had enough...
Kal'tsit, Doctor, Theresis... all of you.
All of you have your big dreams and ambitions. You talk about doing great things.
But did it change anything in the end? People keep dying, the people who should die, the people who shouldn't, and the people who really shouldn't. And you won't even let her have her final rest!
To hell with the myriad souls and the suffering of the Sarkaz. Why should a person have to bear all this burden?
All of you can go to hell!
I'll blow this place... the place of her desecration to oblivion.

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Dust fills the entire cavern. The decrepit ornaments lie in ruins. Yet, the explosions are not enough to quench her anger.
In the deepest reaches of the cavern, a lone altar resembling a door remains.
What is this?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Your Highness?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: W pushes the door open.
